lrml:LegalRuleML.lrml:Comment: Tobacco and Primary Medical Services (Scotland) Act 2010 asp 3 (Scottish Act) Part 1 TOBACCO AND NICOTINE VAPOUR PRODUCTS ETC. Chapter 1 DISPLAY, SALE AND PURCHASE Display of tobacco products etc.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: A person who in the course of business displays or causes to be displayed tobacco products or smoking related products in a place where tobacco products are offered for sale commits an offence.
A person does not commit an offence under subsection (1) if the display - is in a specialist tobacconist,

lrml:Prohibition.lrml:Paraphrase: does not include cigarettes or hand-rolling tobacco

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: A person does not commit an offence under subsection the tobacco products or smoking related products are displayed in the course of a business involving the sale of tobacco products only to persons who carry on a tobacco business (or their employees)

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Paraphrase: the display complies with any prescribed requirements.

lrml:Permission.lrml:Paraphrase: The Scottish Ministers may provide in regulations that no offence is committed under subsection (1) in relation to a display of tobacco products or smoking related products which complies with requirements specified in the regulations.

lrml:Penalty.lrml:Paraphrase: A person guilty of an offence under subsection (1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 4 on the standard scale.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: For the purposes of subsection (1), a website is not a place.
In subsection (2), “specialist tobacconist”has the meaning given by section 6(2) of the Tobacco Advertising and Promotion Act 2002 (c.36).

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Paraphrase: The Scottish Ministers may by regulations provide that a display of tobacco products or smoking related products which also amounts to an advertisement is to be treated for the purposes of offences under this Act and the Tobacco Advertising and Promotion Act 2002

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: as an advertisement and not as a display.
as a display and not as an advertisement.

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Paraphrase: The Scottish Ministers may by regulations impose requirements in relation to the display in the course of business of prices of tobacco products or smoking related products in a place where tobacco products are offered for sale.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: For the purposes of subsection (1), a website is not a place
but the regulations may otherwise provide for the meaning of “place” in that subsection.

lrml:Prohibition.lrml:Paraphrase: A person who displays or causes to be displayed prices of tobacco products or smoking related products in breach of a requirement contained in the regulations commits an offence.
A person guilty of an offence under subsection (3) is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 4 on the standard scale.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: The regulations may provide that a display of prices which also amounts to an advertisement is to be treated for the purposes of offences under this Act and the Tobacco Advertising and Promotion Act 2002
as an advertisement and not as a display of prices
as a display of prices and not as an advertisement.

lrml:Statements.lrml:Comment: 4 Sale of tobacco products to persons under 18

lrml:Prohibition.lrml:Paraphrase: A person who sells a tobacco product or cigarette papers to a person under the age of 18 commits an offence.

lrml:Permission.lrml:Paraphrase: It is a defence to a charge in proceedings against a person (“the accused”) under subsection (1) that the accused believed the person under the age of 18 (“the customer”) to be aged 18 or over,

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Paraphrase: the accused had taken reasonable steps to establish the customer's age.
For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), the accused is to be treated as having taken reasonable steps to establish the customer's age if and only if
the accused was shown any of the documents mentioned in subsection (4),
that document would have convinced a reasonable person as to the customer's age.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: The documents referred to in subsection (3)(a) are any document bearing to be
a passport
a European Union photocard driving licence
such other document, or a document of such description, as may be prescribed.

lrml:Penalty.lrml:Comment: A person guilty of an offence under subsection (1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 4 on the standard scale.

lrml:Statements.lrml:Comment: 4A Sale of nicotine vapour products to persons under 18

lrml:Prohibition.lrml:Paraphrase: A person who sells a nicotine vapour product to a person under the age of 18 commits an offence.

lrml:Permission.lrml:Paraphrase: It is a defence to a charge in proceedings against a person (“the accused”) under subsection (1) that he accused believed the person under the age of 18 (“the customer”) to be aged 18 or over,

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Paraphrase: the accused had taken reasonable steps to establish the customer's age.

lrml:Perscriptive.lrml:Paraphrase: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), the accused is to be treated as having taken reasonable steps to establish the customer's age if and only if

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Paraphrase: the accused was shown any of the documents mentioned in subsection (4)
that document would have convinced a reasonable person as to the customer's age.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: The documents referred to in subsection (3)(a) are any document bearing to be
a passport
a European Union photocard driving licence
such other document, or a document of such description, as may be prescribed.

lrml:Penalty.lrml:Comment: A person guilty of an offence under subsection (1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 4 on the standard scale.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: A person commits an offence if the person—carries on a tobacco or nicotine vapour product business

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Paraphrase: fails to operate an age verification policy in respect of premises at which the person carries on the tobacco or nicotine vapour product business.

ruleml:Rule.lrml:Paraphrase: Subsection (1) does not apply to premises (“the business premises”) from which
tobacco products, cigarette papers or nicotine vapour products are, in pursuance of a sale, despatched for delivery to different premises
no other tobacco or nicotine vapour product business is carried on from the business premises.

An “age verification policy”is a policy that steps are to be taken to establish the age of a person attempting to buy a tobacco product, cigarette papers or a nicotine vapour product on the premises (the “customer”) if it appears to the person selling the tobacco product, cigarette papers or nicotine vapour product that the customer may be under the age of 25 (or such older age as may be specified in the policy).
The Scottish Ministers may by regulations amend the age specified in subsection (3).

lrml:Permission.lrml:Comment: The Scottish Ministers may publish guidance on matters relating to age verification policies, including, in particular, guidance about

lrml:Obligation.lrml:Comment: steps that should be taken to establish a customer's age
documents that may be shown to the person selling a tobacco product, cigarette papers or a nicotine vapour product as evidence of a customer's age
training that should be undertaken by the person selling the tobacco product, cigarette papers or nicotine vapour product
the form and content of notices that should be displayed in the premises
A person who carries on a tobacco or nicotine vapour product business must have regard to guidance published under subsection (5) when operating an age verification policy.

lrml:Penalty.lrml:Comment: A person guilty of an offence under subsection (1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding level 2 on the standard scale.
